article.title: Can I resume my download if it was interrupted?
article.description: Yes. Find the torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click Actions, then click Start.
article.description_text: Yes. Find the torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click Actions, then click Start.

articleList.title: BitTorrent Web quit unexpectedly
articleList.description:
ISSUE:

Some users report the app crashes and you get a message "BitTorrent Web quit unexpectedly". In similar cases, users report a "Connection Error" red box alert. 

SOLUTION:

If you experience the above problem, please remove damaged files from your computer. Watch the video below to learn how to remove the files. 

VIDEO:
articleList.description_text: ISSUE:  Some users report the app crashes and you get a message "BitTorrent Web quit unexpectedly". In similar cases, users report a "Connection Error" red box alert.   SOLUTION:  If you experience the above problem, please remove damaged files from your computer. Watch the video below to learn how to remove the files.   VIDEO:

articleList.title: Can't play audio or video in Safari
articleList.description:
BACKGROUND

Some users report they are unable to play certain movie files in BitTorrent Web. Other people report the audio works but the video does not.

SOLUTION

As of January 23, 2020, we do not have a permanent solution for this problem. We are working on a resolution but do not have any timeline to share. Please use VLC to play any files that do not play in uTorrent Web. You can download the latest VLC here -https://www.videolan.org/vlc/download-macosx.html
articleList.description_text: BACKGROUND  Some users report they are unable to play certain movie files in BitTorrent Web. Other people report the audio works but the video does not.  SOLUTION  As of January 23, 2020, we do not have a permanent solution for this problem. We are working on a resolution but do not have any timeline to share. Please use VLC to play any files that do not play in uTorrent Web. You can download the latest VLC here -https://www.videolan.org/vlc/download-macosx.html

articleList.title: ** will damage your computer. You should move it to the Trash.
articleList.description:
Issue:

Some users may see a security alert when attempting to install our web client on Mac. This is often caused by a previous installation of the app. 

Solutions:

1) Install using the pkg: 

http://btweb-assets.bittorrent.com/installer/BitTorrentWebInstaller.pkg


2) Delete the previous version manually by following the steps:

  •     Quit BitTorrent Web
  •     Click on the Finder icon
  •     Navigate to Finder menu, Go -> Go to Folder
  •     Copy and paste this path in the text box   

                "~/Library/Application Support/BitTorrent Web/" 

  •     Delete all the files 
  •     Go back to Finder, click on Applications
  •     Delete BitTorrent Web
  •     click on the install link in #1 to reinstall
articleList.description_text: Issue:  Some users may see a security alert when attempting to install our web client on Mac. This is often caused by a previous installation of the app.   Solutions:  1) Install using the pkg:   http://btweb-assets.bittorrent.com/installer/BitTorrentWebInstaller.pkg       2) Delete the previous version manually by following the steps:       Quit BitTorrent Web      Click on the Finder icon      Navigate to Finder menu, Go -> Go to Folder      Copy and paste this path in the text box                      "~/Library/Application Support/BitTorrent Web/"        Delete all the files       Go back to Finder, click on Applications      Delete BitTorrent Web      click on the install link in #1 to reinstall

articleList.title: Installing BitTorrent Web
articleList.description:
Stream torrents while you download. Ideal for new users.

Please download BitTorrent Web from here: https://www.bittorrent.com/products/win/bittorrent-web-compare/

Follow the instructions on the installer.

If you get any errors during the installation process, feel free to submit a ticket including a screenshot: https://help.bittorrent.com/support/tickets/new

We will make sure to get back to you within 24-48 business hours.

articleList.title: How do I get started?
articleList.description:
BitTorrent Web is our simplest, easiest to use torrent client yet. It’s designed to help you search, download and stream in a few steps. Here are the basic steps to get started - 

1. Install BitTorrent Web

2. FOR CHROME USERS ONLY: Install our Chrome Browser extension "Safe Torrent Scanner"

- click on "Add to Chrome" 


3. Search for your favorite file using our improved search 

4. Find a torrent file from the Google Search Results
articleList.description_text: BitTorrent Web is our simplest, easiest to use torrent client yet. It’s designed to help you search, download and stream in a few steps. Here are the basic steps to get started -   1. Install BitTorrent Web  2. FOR CHROME USERS ONLY: Install our Chrome Browser extension "Safe Torrent Scanner"  - click on "Add to Chrome"        3. Search for your favorite file using our improved search     4. Find a torrent file from the Google Search Results

articleList.title: What's the benefit of using Adaware Safe Torrent Scanner?
articleList.description: It makes the files and magnet links available in-line with your Google search results.  What does this mean?  You don’t need to leave the safety of Google to download torrents.  Clicking a file from the extension begins your download immediately, without you needing to visit a site you may not know or trust.
articleList.description_text: It makes the files and magnet links available in-line with your Google search results.  What does this mean?  You don’t need to leave the safety of Google to download torrents.  Clicking a file from the extension begins your download immediately, without you needing to visit a site you may not know or trust.

articleList.title: Do you recommend Adaware's Safe Torrent Scanner Extension?
articleList.description: Yes, the extension creates a faster, safer way to download torrents.  When you search for a torrent, Google search results can deliver you to sites that are unsafe.  At best, the files can be difficult to find.  Browser Safety makes torrent files and magnet links available in-line with your Google search results. What does this mean?  You don’t need to leave the safety of Google to download torrents.  Clicking a magnet link from the extension begins your download immediately, without you needing to visit a site you may not know or trust.

What does this mean?  You don’t need to leave the safety of Google to download torrents.  Clicking a magnet link from the extension begins your download immediately, without you needing to visit a site you may not know or trust.

articleList.title: Why should I seed after I download?
articleList.description: BitTorrent is a peer to peer system that only works if you share. A good rule of thumb is to seed the files you have downloaded, to make them available to other peers. By the way, the more you seed, the faster your future downloads are likely to be.
articleList.description_text: BitTorrent is a peer to peer system that only works if you share. A good rule of thumb is to seed the files you have downloaded, to make them available to other peers. By the way, the more you seed, the faster your future downloads are likely to be.

articleList.title: How do I set up my download to exclude some files?
articleList.description: Once your download has started, click ‘Files’ to the right of the torrent you are downloading. This will show all of the files being downloaded. To stop downloading specific files, switch the toggle to the Off position. This will exclude specific files from being downloaded.
articleList.description_text: Once your download has started, click ‘Files’ to the right of the torrent you are downloading. This will show all of the files being downloaded. To stop downloading specific files, switch the toggle to the Off position. This will exclude specific files from being downloaded.

articleList.title: When streaming, can I turn on subtitles?
articleList.description:
Yes, BitTorrent Web supports 2 different types of subtitles

1. Subtitles embedded in the movie file

2. Subtitle files that you load from external sources (SRT files)


INSTRUCTIONS TO LOAD EXTERNAL SUBTITLES (ex. SRT files)

1. Click on the "cc" icon in the lower right corner of the video player. See image below.

2. Click on the "+ Subtitles track" button

3. Locate and select the SRT file for the movie you are watching

4. BitTorrent Web loads the SRT file in to the video player

5. Select the subtitle you want to display on your video player
articleList.description_text: Yes, BitTorrent Web supports 2 different types of subtitles  1. Subtitles embedded in the movie file  2. Subtitle files that you load from external sources (SRT files)     INSTRUCTIONS TO LOAD EXTERNAL SUBTITLES (ex. SRT files)  1. Click on the "cc" icon in the lower right corner of the video player. See image below.  2. Click on the "+ Subtitles track" button  3. Locate and select the SRT file for the movie you are watching  4. BitTorrent Web loads the SRT file in to the video player  5. Select the subtitle you want to display on your video player

articleList.title: How do I specify where to store my downloads?
articleList.description: You can do this in a few steps. First, make sure BitTorrent Web is open in your Web browser. Next, click the settings (gears) icon in the top right hand side of the page. Next, find the Default downloads folder and click Change. Enter your new folder location (if you don’t want it to be the default downloads folder) and click Save.
articleList.description_text: You can do this in a few steps. First, make sure BitTorrent Web is open in your Web browser. Next, click the settings (gears) icon in the top right hand side of the page. Next, find the Default downloads folder and click Change. Enter your new folder location (if you don’t want it to be the default downloads folder) and click Save.

articleList.title: How do I keep a copy of a video I just watched?
articleList.description: This happens automatically.  Files you download are automatically copied and stored in your Downloads folder, or whichever folder you have specified to be your default.  To see the copy of the video you just downloaded, open the folder where it’s stored.  You can do this manually from Windows Explorer, or just click on the torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click Folder to reveal the video file.
articleList.description_text: This happens automatically.  Files you download are automatically copied and stored in your Downloads folder, or whichever folder you have specified to be your default.  To see the copy of the video you just downloaded, open the folder where it’s stored.  You can do this manually from Windows Explorer, or just click on the torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click Folder to reveal the video file.

articleList.title: How can I change the audio channels in videos?
articleList.description: At this time, it is not possible to change the audio channels. But rest assured, this feature is coming soon.
articleList.description_text: At this time, it is not possible to change the audio channels. But rest assured, this feature is coming soon.

articleList.title: How do I find the files inside the torrent?
articleList.description: Once your download has started, click ‘Files’ to the right of the torrent you are downloading. This will show all of the files being downloaded. From this view, you can monitor the progress of each file download, or switch the toggle to the Off position for the file(s) you want to exclude. Alternatively, once the files have finished downloading, click on the torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click Folder, which will reveal the files.
articleList.description_text: Once your download has started, click ‘Files’ to the right of the torrent you are downloading. This will show all of the files being downloaded. From this view, you can monitor the progress of each file download, or switch the toggle to the Off position for the file(s) you want to exclude. Alternatively, once the files have finished downloading, click on the torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click Folder, which will reveal the files.

articleList.title: How do I turn on or off notifications?
articleList.description: At this time, notifications are always enabled in BitTorrent Web.
articleList.description_text: At this time, notifications are always enabled in BitTorrent Web.

articleList.title: Do downloads continue when I close the window?
articleList.description: Yes, your downloads still continue.  Navigating to another window in your browser, or closing the window where BitTorrent Web is running does not stop your download(s).  As long as BitTorrent Web is running and available in your system tray, your downloads will continue until completed.  Of course, you can stop your downloads manually by exiting the application or by pausing or removing the torrent(s) from your Torrent Feed.
articleList.description_text: Yes, your downloads still continue.  Navigating to another window in your browser, or closing the window where BitTorrent Web is running does not stop your download(s).  As long as BitTorrent Web is running and available in your system tray, your downloads will continue until completed.  Of course, you can stop your downloads manually by exiting the application or by pausing or removing the torrent(s) from your Torrent Feed.

articleList.title: How do I use a scheduler?
articleList.description: At this time, a scheduler function is not enabled in BitTorrent Web.  But rest assured, this feature is coming soon.
articleList.description_text: At this time, a scheduler function is not enabled in BitTorrent Web.  But rest assured, this feature is coming soon.

articleList.title: How do I change the default download destination?
articleList.description: Click the settings icon (gears) at the top of the window when BitTorrent Web is open.  Under the default download folder, click Change, then enter the folder location that you would like to set as the default, and click Save.
articleList.description_text: Click the settings icon (gears) at the top of the window when BitTorrent Web is open.  Under the default download folder, click Change, then enter the folder location that you would like to set as the default, and click Save.

articleList.title: How do I pause a torrent?
articleList.description: Find the torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click the blue text that says ‘Downloading’ or ‘Seeding’.  This will pause the torrent.  Alternatively, you can click on the torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click Actions, then click Pause.
articleList.description_text: Find the torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click the blue text that says ‘Downloading’ or ‘Seeding’.  This will pause the torrent.  Alternatively, you can click on the torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click Actions, then click Pause.

articleList.title: I’m downloading several files. How do I manage a download priority queue?
articleList.description: Currently, there is not a configurable way to manage a download priority queue.  As a workaround, you can pause other torrents that are currently downloading, to give priority to another torrent(s) you want to download.  To do this, find the torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click the blue text that says ‘Downloading’. This will pause the torrent. Alternatively, you can click on the torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click Actions, then click Pause.
articleList.description_text: Currently, there is not a configurable way to manage a download priority queue.  As a workaround, you can pause other torrents that are currently downloading, to give priority to another torrent(s) you want to download.  To do this, find the torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click the blue text that says ‘Downloading’. This will pause the torrent. Alternatively, you can click on the torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click Actions, then click Pause.

articleList.title: How do I transfer files from my download folder?
articleList.description:
BACKGROUND

After you download a file, you may want to move the files from one folder to another. Or you may want to transfer to an external hard drive

SOLUTION

1. Click on the "folder" icon below for the torrent you want to move

2. Your Windows or Mac file explorer will launch and allow you to move the files to any location you prefer

3. You will need to remove torrent file from BitTorrent Web using the "trash can" icon
articleList.description_text: BACKGROUND  After you download a file, you may want to move the files from one folder to another. Or you may want to transfer to an external hard drive  SOLUTION  1. Click on the "folder" icon below for the torrent you want to move  2. Your Windows or Mac file explorer will launch and allow you to move the files to any location you prefer  3. You will need to remove torrent file from BitTorrent Web using the "trash can" icon

articleList.title: How do I prevent my computer from sleeping while downloading?
articleList.description: Go to your Control Panel, then your Power Options, then set your sleep mode to Never.
articleList.description_text: Go to your Control Panel, then your Power Options, then set your sleep mode to Never.

articleList.title: How do I stop seeding a torrent?
articleList.description: To stop a torrent from seeding, click on the torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click Actions, then click Remove. Alternatively, click the torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click click Files, then switch the toggle to the Off position for the file(s) you want to stop seeding.
articleList.description_text: To stop a torrent from seeding, click on the torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click Actions, then click Remove. Alternatively, click the torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click click Files, then switch the toggle to the Off position for the file(s) you want to stop seeding.

articleList.title: Can I resume my download if it was interrupted?
articleList.description: Yes. Find the torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click Actions, then click Start.
articleList.description_text: Yes. Find the torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click Actions, then click Start.

articleList.title: How long do I have to wait before I click play?
articleList.description: So long as your download has started to make progress, you can start to play.  Doing so automatically brings your torrent to the top of the download queue to ensure minimal to no delay in the playback.
articleList.description_text: So long as your download has started to make progress, you can start to play.  Doing so automatically brings your torrent to the top of the download queue to ensure minimal to no delay in the playback.

articleList.title: How do I open files in my media player?
articleList.description: Open the folder containing your files.  To do this, open the folder manually from Windows Explorer, or just click on the torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click Folder.  Next, open your player (e.g. VLC), then drag the file from your folder into your player.
articleList.description_text: Open the folder containing your files.  To do this, open the folder manually from Windows Explorer, or just click on the torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click Folder.  Next, open your player (e.g. VLC), then drag the file from your folder into your player.

articleList.title: I want to download several files. How do I know which files will download first?
articleList.description: At this time, it is not possible to prioritize your downloads by specifying which should download first.  However, there is a manual workaround you can do when several files are in the process of downloading.  To do this, you will need to pause the files that are downloading ahead of your preferred file.  To pause files, find the torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click the blue text that says ‘Downloading’.  This will pause the torrent.  Alternatively, click on a torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click Actions, then click Pause.
articleList.description_text: At this time, it is not possible to prioritize your downloads by specifying which should download first.  However, there is a manual workaround you can do when several files are in the process of downloading.  To do this, you will need to pause the files that are downloading ahead of your preferred file.  To pause files, find the torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click the blue text that says ‘Downloading’.  This will pause the torrent.  Alternatively, click on a torrent in your Torrent Feed, then click Actions, then click Pause.

articleList.title: Can I watch while downloading?
articleList.description: Yes.  Once your file begins downloading, click the Play icon to the left of the torrent in your Torrent Feed.  This allows you to watch the torrent while it’s downloading.
articleList.description_text: Yes.  Once your file begins downloading, click the Play icon to the left of the torrent in your Torrent Feed.  This allows you to watch the torrent while it’s downloading.

articleList.title: Error: BitTorrent Web (Autoupdate).app will damage your computer
articleList.description:
ERROR:

Some users report a message that says "BitTorrent Web (Autoupdate).app will damage your computer. You should move it to the Trash. See image below.

RESOLUTION as of Feb 10 2020

  1. Please download the latest version from https://www.bittorrent.com/
  2. Re-install the application

If you continue to experience problems, please submit a ticket here: https://www.bittorrent.com/help/helpCenterSubmitTicket/
